英文.title: July 8 coronavirus news
英文.content:
The Ohio State Department of Athletics announced today that the school has paused all voluntary workouts, “following the results of its most recent Covid-19 testing of student-athletes.” The school is not sharing infection data publicly because "it could lead to the identification of specific individuals and compromise their medical privacy," the university's athletics department said in its statement. The pause affects men’s and women’s basketball, field hockey, football, men’s and women’s soccer and women’s volleyball. “If a student-athlete tests positive for Covid-19, he/she will self-isolate for at least 14 days and receive daily check-ups from the Department of Athletics medical staff. Student-athletes living alone will isolate in their residence. If they have roommates, they will self-isolate in a designated room on campus," the statement said. Earlier Wednesday, the University of North Carolina suspended its football program’s voluntary workout program after 37 players and staff tested positive for Covid-19. ##Cases## Coronavirus was probably spreading widely across the US in February, new modeling data suggests, and it only took a few imported cases from other countries to set off rapid spread inside the borders. While direct imports from China and other countries may have been responsible for the early introduction of Covid-19 to the US, most spread was state to state, researchers led by a team at Northeastern University in Boston reported. “We estimate widespread community transmission of SARS-CoV-2 in February, 2020,” a team led by Northeastern’s Laboratory for the Modeling of Biological and Socio-technical Systems wrote on MedRxiv, a pre-print server. The action, which mandates that all indigenous people must have access to the public indigenous health system, was initiated by the Association of Indigenous Peoples of Brazil (APIB) The latest numbers: According to APIB, until June 7, more than 12,000 indigenous people were infected with novel coronavirus, and at least 445 died since the beginning of the pandemic in the country. According to the Brazilian Indigenous Health service (SESAI), 3,421 indigenous people were infected and 184 died of the virus since the beginning of the pandemic.  SESAI only counts indigenous people living in indigenous territories, not urban centers.  ##Hotspots## Gilead Sciences, the maker of remdesivir, has announced the start of clinical trials for an inhaled version of the antiviral drug to treat Covid-19 patients who do not require hospitalization. The trial will be comprised of 60 healthy individuals ages 18-45 in the US to determine the safety and tolerability of the drug in this format. “With promising data emerging from the randomized, clinical trials of intravenous remdesivir administered to hospitalized patients, it became clear that efforts were needed to investigate the drug’s potential in the outpatient setting. Significant research efforts have been undertaken to deliver remdesivir in an inhaled, nebulized format. We are pleased to announce the initiation of a Phase 1a clinical study to evaluate the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of an investigational, inhaled solution of remdesivir in healthy volunteers,” Gilead Sciences Chief Medical Officer Dr. Merdad Parsey said in a statement Wednesday. Remdesivir, which is currently administered intravenously through infusions, is the only drug that has an emergency use authorization from the US Food and Drug Administration to treat coronavirus infections. “Additional clinical trials evaluating remdesivir in combination with anti-inflammatory medicines, in vulnerable patient populations and in outpatient settings are ongoing or planned to initiate in the near future,” the statement said.   In the past 13 days, Florida's Miami-Dade County has seen a 70% increase in the number of Covid-19 patients being hospitalized. The number of intensive care unit beds being used has risen to 84% and the use of ventilators is at 116%, according to the latest data released by Miami-Dade County government. ##Cases## ##Hotspots## Chile's Ministry of Health reported 2,064 new cases of coronavirus Wednesday, bringing the country's total to 303,083. The number of new cases represent an increase of 0.69% in the last 24 hours, the lowest figure recorded since early May, according to CNN's count. However, health authorities reported 139 new deaths on Wednesday, a sharp increase of 2.16% on the new number of daily deaths since July 4 – bringing the death toll to 6,573. Lockdown easing measures were announced Wednesday for the regions of Aysen and Los Rios and they will take effect starting next Monday.   “I thank our people who have allowed us to start this de-escalation process very slowly and very carefully," Chile’s Health Minister Enrique Paris said. For those regions, sporting events of 10 people maximum in enclosed spaces and up to 50 in open areas are now permitted. People older than 75 can now go outside once a day. Theaters, cinemas, restaurants and cafes can operate at a 25% maximum capacity, according to Chile’s authorities. ##Cases## West Virginia is setting up September 8 as its target date for reopening schools across the state, Gov. Jim Justice said Wednesday in a news conference. The governor said the state feels ready to start now if it was safe but said he knows and believes it is too early. Gov. Justice also voiced his support for President Trump and his hopes for his reelection in the fall as part of a passing statement about Trump's desire to get kids back to school. Positive case rates continue to increase in West Virginia, the governor said. The positivity rate in the state is under 2%, but that rate has varied from testing period to testing period.  Justice faced pushback for using CARES Act funds toward road and highway rehabilitation and repairs across the state but defended his actions Wednesday with the justification that the state has extra money that he'd otherwise have to give back at the end of the year if it didn't get claimed. ##Schools## Miami-Dade County officials reported a 28% Covid-19 positivity rate on Wednesday, according to data released by Mayor Carlos Giménez's office. The positivity rate is tracked daily by the county.  Giménez's office said the goal is to not exceed a positivity rate of 10%. The county has exceeded the 10% mark for the past 14 days. The current 14-day average is 23%, the data shows. Remember: A positivity rate is the percentage of people who test positive for the virus of those overall who have been tested.  So, as more and more people are being tested, the focus is shifting to the positivity rate — how many of those tested are actually infected. ##Hotspots## New York City has 18,618 confirmed coronavirus deaths and 4,606 probable coronavirus deaths as of July 8, according to the most recent data on the city website. The New York City Health Department defines probable deaths as people who did not have a positive Covid-19 laboratory test, but their death certificate lists as the cause of death “Covid-19” or an equivalent. The total number of confirmed coronavirus deaths and probable coronavirus deaths in New York City is 23,224. There have been 214,570 coronavirus cases in the city and 55,280 people have been hospitalized, according to the city.  The data is from the New York City Health Department and was updated on July 8 at 1 p.m., according to the website. To note: The numbers may not line up exactly in real time with CNN’s database drawn from Johns Hopkins University and the Covid Tracking Project. ##Cases## Schools must reopen, but they have to do so safely, former US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention director Dr. Tom Frieden said Wednesday.  “Education is essential. Interruptions in education because of coronavirus have cost millions of students precious little time and have slowed or stalled educational progress,” Frieden, who is now CEO of the advocacy and public health consultancy group Resolve to Save Lives, said during a livestream event to outline the organization’s blueprint for how to reopen schools safely. “Schools are also essential for the overall educational and social development of children, as well as in the functioning of the overall economy. It's not, we think, a matter of whether to open schools but how to do it as safely as possible,” Frieden added. However, he warned, “we can't just charge forward." "That's not going to work, because of what happened in Arizona, Texas, Florida and elsewhere: one step forward too fast, many steps backward, and for a long time. Trying to open schools without accounting for and protecting students and staff from Covid is going to backfire,” said Frieden.   ##Schools## There are currently 42 Florida hospitals that are at zero capacity for intensive care unit beds. This is down from 56 hospitals reported on Tuesday, according to Florida's Agency for Healthcare Administration (AHCA).   On Wednesday, 54 hospitals around the state were at 10% capacity or less, according to the AHCA dashboard. "Hospitals have the ability to convert beds and bring additional ICU beds online in a surge situation when necessary," the AHCA said in a statement to CNN.  Boca Raton Hospital in Palm Beach County normally has 230 adult ICU beds, there are just 11 available; lowering their capacity to 4.56%, according to AHCA. Miami-Dade County has 992 adult ICU beds in its hospitals but currently 170 are available, 17.14% capacity, AHCA data shows. "The state has established a field hospital at the Miami Beach Convention Center with over 450 beds to allow for even greater capacity if necessary," the AHCA statement said.   ##Hotspots## Despite Florida’s order to reopen schools in “brick and mortar” fashion in the fall, Broward County Schools could remain closed because Broward County is still in phase one of the reopening plan, according to Robert Runcie, Broward County Public Schools Superintendent.  “One other thing to note is that Miami-Dade and Broward have teachers and other employees who live in the neighboring county, which means our fates are interconnected and decisions must ultimately have some alignment across counties,” Runcie told CNN’s Rosa Flores.  Earlier today, school superintendent Alberto Carvalho of Miami-Dade County — which is directly south of Broward County — tweeted his school system would “ONLY proceed with in-person schooling” if Miami-Dade County successfully transitioned to phase two. Miami-Dade is currently in phase one. ##Reopening## ##Schools## New Jersey Gov. Phil Murphy said the state reported 335 new Covid-19 cases, bringing its total to more than 174,000. The daily positivity rate for tests recorded on Monday is 3.23%, Murphy said, even though the state has been hovering at about 2%. The number of tests counted Monday was very low, which may account for the increase, Murphy said.  The governor added that there have been "a couple flare ups" related to out-of-state travel. “There’s another increment of risk we’re getting from folks coming in from other states that have exploded and continue to explode," he said. He added that the system “so far so good has worked spotting some of these flare ups relating to out-of-state travel, as well as some knucklehead behavior in state.” Remember: New Jersey, along with New York and Connecticut, require travelers coming from at least 19 states with high coronavirus rates to quarantine for at least two weeks once they enter the state.   ##Cases## Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said the number of coronavirus cases, hospitalizations, and deaths are declining across the country.  “The situation is stabilizing in Canada because Canadians did their part and followed public health instructions. But we still have to be very careful. Things can change quickly … we still have some hotspots in some parts of the country, including in long-term care facilities and agricultural work settings, so as we continue to gradually reopen the economy, we have to remain vigilant,” Trudeau said. "Canada has one of the most ambitious and comprehensive plans to counter the economic impacts of this pandemic," he added. Trudeau said they increased financial support to “vulnerable groups like seniors and students” and those who lost their jobs during the pandemic, as well as provided loans to businesses. ##Cases## Spanish Health Minister, Salvador Illa, told a Catalan Radio on Wednesday, that the outbreaks in the country present "a worrying situation."  "We know there are outbreaks, all countries that have managed to control the pandemic have them, as it is the situation in Spain. We monitor them with concern and daily," he said.  Spain registered 257 new cases on Wednesday, over half of them linked to outbreaks in Catalonia, Aragon, Galicia and Andalusia.  The total number of cases in the country is at least 252,513. The government's data also shows that four people died from coronavirus in Spain in the last 24 hours, bringing the total number of coronavirus-related deaths to 28,396. ##Cases## New Jersey Gov. Phil Murphy is making changes to allow for more restaurants to have outdoor dining. The state will be explicitly allowing areas with fixed roofs with at least two open sides, comprising at least 50% of the total wall space, to be considered outdoors “in light of their airflow.”  He reiterated today, “we are just not ready to open up indoor dining.” ##Reopening## Clobbered by the coronavirus pandemic, United Airlines is sending warning letters nearly half of its frontline workforce that they could be furloughed when restrictions on a federal bailout expire October 1. The world's third-largest airline says 36,000 workers — including 15,000 flight attendants, 11,000 customer service and gate agents, 5,550 maintenance employees and 2,250 pilots — are about to receive 60-day mass layoff notices. The reductions are in addition to furloughs of office-based employees the company previously said it would cut.  "The reality is that United simply cannot continue at our current payroll level past October 1 in an environment where travel demand is so depressed," the company said in a message to employees.  The Wednesday announcement paints a grim picture for an air travel recovery only days after United announced it would ramp up its schedule in August.   The airline is operating only a quarter of flights compared to last year and says that planes are, on average, 55% full. United executives say demand for air travel has slipped recently in markets such as New York, where bookings at its Newark hub dropped as Covid cases surged.  United executives told reporters the company has done everything it can to protect employees — urging them to take early retirement and voluntary separation plans and aggressively raising millions in new money — but the airline is still hemorrhaging $40 million each day.  The airline, which reached an agreement this week with the Treasury Department to tap a loan fund, is also not counting on another round of relief to pass Congress.  “We do not feel like we can count on additional federal government support to survive and we have to take steps to protect the company and protect the long-term interest of the company and the prospects for united employees,” a company executive said. ##Economy## New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo announced new details on reopening plans and provided updates on coronavirus case numbers at a briefing today. Here's what you need to know: Schools: By July 31, local school districts across the state will have to submit their plans including protocols and how they will reopen. On August 1-7, the state will announce a decision on whether or not those schools reopen.
Malls: Beginning Friday, malls can open in phase four regions so long as they have enhanced HVAC filtration system and measures in place. The Department of Health is asking for malls to install MERV-13 filters or the highest compatible filter for their current system which can filter out coronavirus.
Hospitalizations: There were 841 hospitalizations across New York state as of Tuesday and 97 intubations – the first time the latter number is under 100 and first time this low since March 16. There were 11 deaths on July 7 — nine in hospitals and two in nursing homes.
Testing: In New York City, 1.2% of those tested over the last five days were positive. Cuomo debunked the theory that there are more positive cases across the country because of testing, citing the rise in hospitalizations.
Quarantine list: Nineteen states are on a quarantine list, including the three additions announced Tuesday – Delaware, Kansas and Oklahoma. New York, New Jersey and Connecticut issued a travel advisory last month that requires people arriving from states with high coronavirus rates to quarantine for 14 days. One thing to note: The numbers were released by the state Department of Health and may not line up exactly in real time with CNN’s database drawn from Johns Hopkins University and the Covid Tracking Project. ##Cases## The US has recorded more than 3 million coronavirus cases since the pandemic began, according to Johns Hopkins University numbers. That's almost two times more than the second hardest-hit nation, Brazil, which has reported more than 1.6 million cases. Here's a quick timeline of how quickly the virus spread in the US: Jan. 21: The US reports its first reported case.
99 days later: At least 1 million Americans have been infected
43 days later: The US reports more than 2 million cases
28 days later: The US reached 3 million cases  ##Cases## The White House will be "very respectful" of states and local communities who determine they cannot fully reopen schools, Vice President Mike Pence said Wednesday. Despite President Trump's insistence that all schools reopen, and his vow to pressure governors to do that, Pence acknowledged there could be places where case counts prevent a full return to classrooms. "I think we would account for the fact that while we hope every school in America is able to open this fall, there may be some states and local communities that given cases or positivity in that community may adjust to either a certain set of days or certain limitations," Pence said. "We’ll be very respectful of that," he said, adding it was "imperative" that states "take steps to get kids back into the classroom to the fullest extent possible." He said the federal government would work with localities where outbreaks prevent a full return to in-person schooling. Asked about Trump's threat earlier Wednesday to withhold funding to schools that do not reopen, Pence noted that most education funding comes from states but said that in discussions with Congress about new funding, "we’re going to be looking for a way to give states a strong incentive and encouragement to get kids back to school." ##Schools## WATCH: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Director Dr. Robert Redfield said agency guidance on schools should not be utilized to keep schools closed. “The guidance that CDC continues to put out for schools K-12 and higher learning is intentional for reopening and keeping our schools open,” Redfield said. The CDC will issue new guidance on reopening schools next week.  “I want to make it very clear that what is not the intent of CDC's guidelines is to be used as a rationale to keep schools closed,” he said.  Redfield said his agency is willing to work with individual school districts to advise them on the different strategies outlined in the updated guidance.  “We’re prepared to work with all the school districts and schools to help them facilitate their development of their own unique plan to accomplish that,” he said.  ##Schools## WATCH: New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo brushed off President Trump’s “threat” about defunding states if governors don’t reopen schools.  “You’re not going to bully New Yorkers. That’s not going to happen, right?" he said. The state spends about $70 billion on education each year and only $3 billion comes from the federal government. Those federal funds go to the students most in need, according to Jim Malatras, president of the State University of New York’s Empire State College and working on the governor’s task force for reopening. Expanding on potential schools reopening in the fall, Cuomo said specific district plans can be denied, accepted or districts can be asked for alterations.  Following those decisions, the state will make a global decision as to whether any school district can reopen. He said it’s possible to have a regional reopening and he acknowledged concerns about teachers’ safety. “When we came to the reopening of the economy, I’m said I’m not going to put someone in a dangerous situation. There is no money on the planet that can pay for a life as far as I’m concerned so it’s a balance and the same is with schools,” Cuomo said Wednesday. Responding to a reporter’s question about greenlighting the proposed New York City plan for reopening, Cuomo said ideally you would make the decision the night before. “I don’t have the luxury of waiting for the night before. Our institutional, systemic drop-dead date is the first week in August,” he said. ##Schools## WATCH: White House coronavirus task force coordinator Dr. Deborah Birx said Wednesday that the Trump administration is seeing some “encouraging” trends in Arizona, Texas and Florida — three of the hotspot states seeing a surge of coronavirus cases across the sunbelt. “The seven-day average (of coronavirus cases in Arizona) is showing some flattening and I find that encouraging. Also, equally encouraging at this point, because we know that the test positivity rate is the first thing to increase and we’re hoping that it heralds a stability in Arizona of at least reaching a plateau in their curve,” Birx said. Birx also referenced a stabilizing of emergency room visits for Covid-19-like symptoms in Arizona, calling it “an early indicator and we find that encouraging.”  Similarly, in Florida, Birx said, they are starting to see “early suggestions of decreasing emergency room visits for the symptoms of Covid and some stability starting in that (test positivity rate) hoping that heralds a stability in the number of daily reported cases.” However, CNN's health team notes that they are not hearing the same when it comes to hospitalizations.  “We also understand that we went through a holiday weekend and holiday weekends can impact data on both ends — underreporting through the weekend and catch up reporting on Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday after a holiday weekend,” she added.  “Texas is in a similar situation with their (test positivity rate),” Birx said. ##Cases## ##Hotspots## People living in states with coronavirus surges should return to the White House's original "phase one" recommendations on gatherings, Dr. Deborah Birx said on Wednesday. Citing guidelines like wearing face masks and avoiding bars and indoor events, Birx said those steps should be resumed in order to bring cases back under control. She said they are "asking the American people in those counties and in those states to not only use those face coverings, not going to bars, not going to indoor dining, but really not gathering in homes either. And decreasing those gatherings back down to our phase one recommendation, which was 10 or less." Birx touted the importance of mask-wearing and said "any kind of indoor gathering" should be avoided in places experiencing a spike in cases. President Trump has repeatedly said the economy should not be shut down again, even as cases increase. ##Cases## ##Reopening## WATCH: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention will issue new guidance on reopening schools next week after President Trump dismissed their current recommendations as “very tough & expensive." Speaking at a briefing by the White House coronavirus task force, Vice President Mike Pence said the new guidance would be "part of a five-part series of recommendations that will give all new tools to our schools." "We’re absolutely determined to work in partnership with our states to give the guidance for states and communities to be able to safely reopen our schools," Pence said. Still, he repeated a statement made a day earlier by the CDC's director that the agency's guidelines should not act as a barrier to reopening schools. "We’re here to help," Pence said. "We don't want federal guidance to be a substitute for state and local laws and rules and guidance. We’re here to assist with the shared objective, which I think is shared by every parent in America, which is we want to get our kids back. We want to get them back in the classroom." "As the President made clear yesterday it's time. It's time for us to get our kids back to school," Pence said.  Some context: Earlier Wednesday, Trump accused the CDC of producing “very tough & expensive guidelines for opening schools,” saying he disagreed with the health agency’s recommendations. “While they want them open, they are asking schools to do very impractical things,” Trump wrote. “I will be meeting with them!!!” ##Schools## WATCH: Vice President Mike Pence said the White House coronavirus task force is focusing their efforts in states where half of the new cases have arisen, including Arizona, Florida and California. Pence said governors have described a need for personnel.  "Over the last week, working through FEMA, the Department of Defense and HHS, we've been processing requests to deploy over 1,070 doctors and nurses and medical personnel. At this point, roughly 525 doctors and nurses are on the ground in Arizona, California and Texas and we are processing a request from Florida for an additional amount," Pence said.  Pence is holding a briefing alongside Dr. Deborah Birx, White House coronavirus response coordinator; Brett Giroir, assistant Secretary for Health; Robert Redfield, the head of the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention; Alex Azar, Health and Human Services secretary; and Betsy DeVos, Education secretary. Those in attendance are wearing masks. Pence, who took off his mask to speak, is making comments now. ##Hotspots## ##Politics## WATCH: More than 3 million cases of coronavirus have been reported in the US, according to the latest data from Johns Hopkins University. The US has the most cases of coronavirus of any country in the world. Brazil — which has more than 1.6 million, according to Johns Hopkins' tally — is the second most impacted country. India had the third most cases, with more than 700,000. “Mixed messages” are confusing people and leading to the spread of coronavirus in Florida, says Carlos Hernandez, the mayor of Hialeah, a city in Miami-Dade County.  “That's making it very difficult at the city levels because people are getting different messages from the federal government, state government — even here at the county, we're getting mixed messages,” Herandez said.  “We have to have one message come from the top to the bottom,” he said to CNN’s Kate Bolduan.  The Republican mayor said the lack of contact tracing is “not acceptable.” He said he is not aware of any contact tracing being done in his city by state officials. “This is something that if we don't unite and if we don't all take care of each other, again, we’re going to find ourselves in a very critical situation very soon in south Florida,” he said.  New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo today laid out the timeline for how the state will make the decisions about reopening schools in the fall. School districts will submit their plans for reopening by the end of the month, the governor said during a coronavirus briefing today. After that, Cuomo said, the state will "look at the data in that first week" of August and "we'll make a decision" on reopening schools. Cuomo said that the state "will open the schools if it's safe." ##Reopening## ##Schools## New York Gov. 英文.content_zh: 俄亥俄州体育部今天宣布，学校已经暂停了所有的自愿锻炼，“在最近一次对学生运动员的Covid-19测试结果之后。”学校没有公开分享感染数据，因为“这可能导致特定个人的身份识别，并损害他们的医疗隐私，“大学体育系在声明中说。停摆影响到男女篮球、曲棍球、足球、男女足球和女排。“如果一名学生运动员的Covid-19检测呈阳性，他/她将自我隔离至少14天，并接受体育部医务人员的每日检查。单独居住的学生运动员将被隔离在他们的住处。如果他们有室友，他们会在校园的指定房间里自我隔离。星期三，北卡罗来纳大学的37-19志愿足球项目的工作人员在星期三进行了测试后，暂停了北卡罗来纳大学的37-19志愿足球项目。##最新的模拟数据显示，今年2月，冠状病毒可能在美国广泛传播，只需从其他国家输入少量病例便可在美国境内迅速传播。波士顿东北大学一个研究小组的研究人员报告说，虽然从中国和其他国家的直接进口可能是导致Covid-19早期传入美国的原因，但大多数传播是州与州之间的。“我们估计，2020年2月，SARS-CoV-2在社区广泛传播，”由东北大学生物和社会技术系统建模实验室领导的一个团队在打印前服务器MedRxiv上写道。他们的工作没有经过同行评审。他们写道：“我们的研究结果表明，许多国家是从国内而非国际来源播种的。”。“对大多数大陆国家来说，输入性感染的最大贡献来自国内旅游流。”美国于1月31日宣布限制来自中国的旅行。研究人员说，他们的模型研究表明，这些限制来得太晚了。他们写道：“从中国大陆进口可能与1月份的疫情传播有关，但由于2020年1月23日之后对中国大陆实施旅行限制，因此在美国的COVID-19扩张中起到了很小的作用。”。他们补充说：“内布拉斯加州85%的病毒引进来自国内，86%在新墨西哥州，86%在阿肯色州，95%在北达科他州。”。研究人员写道，该模型与几项研究的证据相吻合，这些研究表明，在1月31日宣布旅行限制措施时，美国已经有相当数量的感染病例。威斯康星大学体育系宣布，自一个月前学校的第一轮检测以来，更多的学生运动员检测出Covid-19呈阳性。在上个月两名最初检测呈阳性后，总共有7名威斯康星州学生运动员被检测出阳性。威斯康星州竞技体育部称正在隔离被检测为阳性的个人，威斯康星州田径队的感染反应小组正在对他们进行监测。##美国著名传染病专家Anthony Fauci博士，白宫冠状病毒专责小组组长、副总统彭斯（Mike Pence）说，“工作做得很好”。福西和特别工作组协调员德博拉·伯克斯博士经常在简报会或采访中发出有关流感大流行的警报，而彭斯则吹嘘特朗普政府的工作做得很好。“公平地说，副总统明白这一点，但他正试图以副总统的身份，在某种意义上，也指出一些进展顺利的事情，”福西在周三的播客中对《华尔街日报》说，“所以，他是一个乐观的人，他做得非常好我必须说，作为特别工作组的领导，我必须说，”福奇说，他是国家过敏和传染病研究所的主任。“我看了数据，分析了数据，并根据证据给出了我最好的意见，”福西说。他说，特别工作组关于流感大流行的讨论有很多方面，他和他的同事主要关注公共卫生。他说，彭斯还有其他担忧。“这是一个问题，从经济学的角度来看，我们需要开放。因此，所有这些都会综合起来，然后你会看到一些建议，但作为特别工作组的一员，我告诉你，我们面临着一个非常严重的情况，我们确实需要解决。”福西说，公共卫生和经济政策需要协同工作。其他健康专家担心，特朗普总统以牺牲美国人的生命为代价，推动经济优先发展。到目前为止，已经有132000多名美国人死于Covid-19另一个原因是，一旦你开始认为有公共卫生和经济开放，看起来他们是对立的力量，”福奇说，“所以，我们要做的是，如果公众健康信息被听到并付诸实施，实际上是一个促进开放的门户，一个更简单的方法，而不是有人在那里亚特兰大市长Keisha Lance Bottoms说，她将于周三签署一项命令，要求在她的城市使用口罩，以减缓冠状病毒感染的数量。“我们已经看到佐治亚州的其他城市强制使用口罩。Bottoms在情况室对CNN的Wolf Blitzer说：“我们决定花一点时间看看州长和州政府对其他城市强制要求戴口罩会有什么反应。我今天在亚特兰大签署了一项同样的命令。”。她说，Covid-19的数字正在“飞黄腾达”，当地的医院很快就满了。“我听到的所有专家都在说，为了帮助减缓传播速度，我们需要强制使用口罩。这就是我们在亚特兰大要做的，希望能对一些人有所帮助。##位于加利福尼亚州洛杉矶县的波莫纳学院院长在周三的一封信中宣布，该学院秋季学期将不欢迎学生回国，并将继续远程学习。Pomona总统G. Gabrielle Starr说：“这种情况并不是我们所希望的。”“在校园里，面对面教育是我们文科使命的核心。现实是，如果我们把学生带回来参加秋季活动，那么在这样的限制条件下，校园生活将与我们所珍视的社区几乎没有相似之处：没有公共集会或表演，没有学生和教授的面对面会议，没有迎新旅行，“不”的名单将会非常多学院表示，学校将在未来几天内与国际学生联系，向他们介绍他们计划如何应对本周早些时候由移民和海关执法部门发布的指导意见。ICE在周一的新闻发布会上说，持有某些签证的学生“可能无法完成全部在线课程而留在美国”，并补充说，本周三，美国国务院将不允许所有学生进入美国边境保护局的学校由于冠状病毒大流行，2020年秋季体育赛将举行。”该组织在一份声明中说：“以学生的安全和福祉为重，常春藤盟校院校正在实施全校范围的政策，包括限制学生和工作人员的旅行、社交距离的要求、团体聚会的限制以及对校园访客的规定。”由于田径运动预计将与校园政策保持一致，常春藤联盟球队将不可能在秋季学期结束前参加校际体育比赛。”常春藤联盟主席理事会成为第一届第一届推迟秋季体育运动（包括大学足球）的会议打篮球到1月1日。第二分区的莫尔豪斯和其他第三分区的学校已经完全取消了他们的赛季。今年3月，大会因为第一个取消男女篮球大会锦标赛而遭到批评，因为这是Covid-19的担忧，但其他主要会议很快也紧随其后。得克萨斯州周三报告了98例与Covid-19相关的死亡病例，是冠状病毒死亡人数单日增幅最高的一次。该州的Covid-19死亡总人数为2813人，该州的Covid-19阳性率也达到了15%，创历史新高。德克萨斯州还记录了9979例新的冠状病毒病例，这是该州有记录以来第二高的病例数。该州Covid-19病例总数为220564例。值得注意的是：这些数据是由德克萨斯州健康和人类服务部发布的，可能与来自约翰霍普金斯大学的CNN数据库和Covid跟踪项目不完全一致。##巴西政府表示，在总统博尔索纳罗（Jair Bolsonaro）检测出Covid-19呈阳性后，不会将最近与他接触过的员工调离办公室。巴西共和国秘书长发表了一份官方声明，称“没有医疗协议，无论是卫生部还是世卫组织，都建议采取简单接触阳性病例的隔离措施。”政府向公共雇员提供了指导，告诉他们“当他们出现症状时应寻求医疗援助根据Covid-19，评估检测的必要性。“如果怀疑有人出现症状，政府说，”员工最好呆在家里直到检查结果出来。”更多信息：根据世界卫生组织（WHO），感染者可以在症状出现前的6天内开始传播病毒。世卫组织建议与感染者有过密切接触的人应在社会上隔离14天，远离工作场所。博尔索纳罗星期二宣布，他在前一天报告发烧后，对Covid-19呈阳性反应。在过去的一周里，巴西总统参加了他的正常议程，与商人、政治家和政府当局举行了会谈。但是据总统新闻办公室称，在周二亲自在媒体面前宣布诊断结果后，博尔索纳罗一直通过视频会议进行工作。##一项发表在美国儿科学会杂志上的研究发现，冠状病毒在儿童身上会引起各种各样的症状，对儿童进行有针对性的检测可能会漏掉病例，布鲁克林梅蒙尼德斯儿童综合医院的拉比亚阿加博士和同事研究了22名患有冠状病毒的儿童医院在三月到四月之间超过四个星期，当时当地的传播很普遍。他们发现，大多数患者没有典型的冠状病毒症状，与成人和中国一些儿科报告相比。病人有各种各样的症状和情况。在22名患者中，几乎一半不到一岁。15个病人发烧了。9人出现呼吸系统症状。两人癫痫发作。16名患者与Covid-19患者没有已知的接触，2名患者完全没有症状。研究中没有病人死亡。研究人员最初遵循美国疾病控制和预防中心的指导方针，只对发烧、咳嗽和呼吸急促的患者、去过高危国家的患者以及与确诊的冠状病毒病例有密切接触的患者进行测试。随着感染率的增加，他们开始检测所有入院的病人，而不管他们的症状。在四个需要机械通气的病人中，只有一个没有潜在的健康状况——一个心脏骤停的健康儿童。三名使用呼吸机的病人有资格同情性地使用抗病毒药物雷姆德西韦，最终被取消呼吸机。7名因非Covid症状住院的患者，包括细菌感染、阑尾炎和肌肉发炎，病毒检测呈阳性。研究人员说，目前还不清楚冠状病毒在他们的疾病中扮演了多大的角色。研究中年龄最小的病人，11天大，母亲健康，很可能在家中被无症状的家庭成员感染。Maimonides团队说，特定时间和地区的感染率，而不是确认的接触，应该驱动检测策略，他们研究的患者中有41%会被忽略，因为他们没有达到当时推荐的冠状病毒检测标准。“检测儿科患者的指南需要扩大，并考虑到患有其他疾病的患者也可能对COVID-19呈阳性，”他们写道，“对所有住院患者进行检测不仅可以在入院过程的早期发现病例，而且有助于防止意外接触其他病人和医护人员，在37名球员和工作人员检测出Covid-19呈阳性后，北卡罗来纳大学暂停了足球项目的自愿锻炼计划。北卡罗来纳州的奥兰治县卫生部门确定了结果是一个集群迫使焦油脚跟停止活动。学校工作人员说，大约有429名教练对科罗纳病毒进行了检测，结果有12%的人返回学校。该大学没有透露37名感染病毒者症状的严重程度。##在美国，一个允许人们自愿参加Covid-19疫苗临床试验的新网站已经上线。coronavi网站俄罗斯预防网络——将为预计将于今夏秋季开始的四项大型疫苗研究以及随后的任何其他研究办理注册手续。美国卫生和公共服务部星期三宣布了该网站，并任命了弗雷德·哈钦森癌症研究中心西雅图作为疫苗临床试验的协调中心，由美国国立卫生研究院资助的Covid-19预防网络负责在参加疫苗研究时，可以填写一份快速问卷。注册后，您的信息将被发送到离您最近的研究站点。其中几个问题旨在评估您感染和感染Covid-19的可能性，包括您的种族、您从事什么工作，以及你每天接触多少人。根据这些答案，你可能会被拒绝。不常出门，出门时戴口罩的人不会成为最好的研究对象。这是因为这项研究的重点是看疫苗是否能保护人们免受Covid-19感染。如果大部分呆在家里的人接种了疫苗，而他们没有感染Covid-19，那就很难知道了如果疫苗保护了他们，或者他们的生活方式让他们远离病毒。一些背景：目前还不清楚所有疫苗试验需要多少志愿者。在6月的一次采访中，美国国家卫生研究院院长弗朗西斯·柯林斯博士告诉CNN，每项试验将有大约3万名志愿者，但弗雷德·哈钦森癌症研究中心星期三发表声明说，将有1万至30名志愿者，在巴西卫生部在过去24小时内录得44571例新病例后，巴西的冠状病毒病例数周三超过170万例。据巴西卫生部统计，该国确诊病例总数为1713160例。卫生部还报告了1223例新的Covid-19死亡病例，使全国死亡人数达到67964人。此前，巴西总统博尔索纳罗（Jair Bolsonaro）周二宣布，他对艾滋病病毒检测呈阳性，他在新闻发布会上摘下口罩，对年轻人说：“如果你受到病毒感染，请放心，对你来说，洛杉矶县卫生局长芭芭拉·费雷尔（Barbara Ferrer）今天说，发生更严重疾病的可能性几乎为零。过去一个月，日均病例数增长了84%，从6月初的1300例增加到今天的2400例。“我们正处在大流行的关键时刻，”费雷尔说，社区传播冠状病毒的增加使住院率达到了4月底以来的最高水平。“我们的病例在上升，感染率在增加，住院人数也在增加，”她补充道。费雷尔说，即使死亡率的小幅上升也令人担忧，因为死亡往往落后于病例增长。此外，南加州一家医院的重症监护室在接收了大量的冠状病毒患者后已满负荷运转，这促使医疗机构为额外的病房开辟了一个缓冲空间。”文图拉县医疗中心的首席执行官约翰·范克豪斯博士今天说，我们能提供的服务是有限度的，我们不能继续我们现在的道路，”他补充说，该机构的重症监护室现在“满员”。目前有71名冠状病毒患者在该县的8家医院住院，31名目前在重症监护室，文图拉县卫生局局长里戈·巴尔加斯说。##公共卫生专家Ashish Jha博士今天对CNN说，美国疾病控制和预防中心重新开学的指导方针是美国应该做的最起码的事情，以确保学校能够重新开学并保持开放。“我认为疾控中心的建议确实很基本，事实上，我认为应该更进一步。听着，你可以在任何地方开办学校。哈佛大学全球健康研究所（Harvard Global Health Institute）的教职主任杰哈（Jha）说。“问题是你能让学校继续开放吗？你能防止教师、教职员工和孩子之间的大规模爆发吗？如果我们不按照疾病预防控制中心的要求去做，甚至更多的话，这些学校将在哥伦布日前全部关闭，而且它们将长期关闭。这是我们必须避免的，我们没有。我们不能虚张声势，我们必须让科学来推动它。”Jha补充说，必须控制Covid-19在社区中的传播，这样学校才能安全开放——这在全国多个热点地区是不会发生的。“在这些热点地区，我们负担不起10人或更多的室内聚会，”Jha说。Jha说，说开学是安全的是“漫不经心”，因为病毒不会像成人那样让儿童生病。Jha指出，孩子们会生病，孩子们也会把病毒传染给成年人。Jha还对美国副总统彭斯（Mike Pence）和冠状病毒特别工作组（Coronavirus Task Force）反应协调员德博拉·伯克斯（Deborah Birx）的言论提出异议，他们说，他们在德克萨斯州、亚利桑那州和佛罗里达州等热点地区看到了令人鼓舞的趋势。Jha说他看到了数字上升，而不是下降。“我看到的数据和他们是一样的，但我没有看到。我希望他们，我希望他们是对的。”。“但在我看来，亚利桑那州、德克萨斯州和佛罗里达州的阳性率仍在上升。病例在增加，住院人数在增加，现在我认为我们有非常明确的证据表明这些地方的死亡率也开始上升。”全国范围内：Jha说，全国冠状病毒感染数字不能提供一个完整的观点。他说，虽然感染率在一些地方下降，如纽约、新泽西和马萨诸塞州，但在美国其他地区，如得克萨斯州、亚利桑那州、佛罗里达州、南卡罗来纳州、密西西比州和内华达州，感染率正在上升。他说：“如果你把它们放在同一张照片里，它看起来是平的。”。##学校（Schools）白宫新闻秘书凯利·麦克南尼（Kayleigh McEnanny）对CNN的凯特兰·柯林斯（Kaitlan Sturgeon）周三在新闻发布会上宣布，苏格兰将取消对来自英国政府豁免名单上相同国家（塞尔维亚和西班牙除外）的旅客的检疫要求。从7月10日开始抵达苏格兰的乘客，从绿色和琥珀色名单上的57个国家（包括德国和挪威）中的任何一个国家旅行，14天内都不必自我孤立。Sturgeon解释说，入选名单的一个关键标准是冠状病毒的流行率“低于或不明显高于苏格兰”，并补充说，正是基于此，政府做出了“艰难的决定”，将西班牙和塞尔维亚排除在宽松的限制之外。Sturgeon引用了联合偏差安全中心的数据报告指出，西班牙的流行率为每10万人中有330例，而苏格兰冠状病毒的流行率目前为每10万人中有28例。相比之下，整个英国的比率是每10万人180人。斯特金说，苏格兰内阁“在现阶段不能出于良知取消对抵达西班牙人员的限制”，并表示“对塞尔维亚”及其最近爆发的疫情感到关切，这促使周边国家关闭边境，她确认这一决定是“证据驱动”的，将于7月20日进行复审。她说：“（它）的动机只有一个决心，那就是在未来几周内尽可能地保护苏格兰不受这种病毒死灰复燃的影响。”。一些背景：上周，西班牙和苏格兰都被列入了一份名单，这些国家的游客可以在14天内不必进行检疫就可以进入英格兰。美国不在名单上。该名单将于7月10日生效，将在英国度假者禁闭4个月后向他们开放外国旅游，正好赶上旅游高峰时期，前提是目的地没有任何限制。美国股市在纽约股市开盘时小幅上涨，但华尔街今天却相当平静。在周二的损失之后，周三没有新的记录出现。由于第二季度财报季要到下周才能正式开始，经济日历上的数据也很少，股市缺乏明显的催化剂。最近几个交易日，一个平静的消息日意味着投资者担心美国各地的Covid-19感染率上升。市场开盘方式如下：道琼斯指数上涨0.2%，或62点。休斯顿联合纪念医疗中心的医务室主任约瑟夫瓦龙博士，Stadler的案例表明人们仍然需要保持警惕，“认为你将是无敌的，因为你已经有过一次日冕症，这绝不是一种保护。人们需要继续对这种疾病保持同样的尊重。他们需要保持他们的社交距离，瓦隆说：“他们需要保留口罩……即使他们已经感染了这种疾病，”当被问及斯塔德勒的两项Covid-19阴性检测是否可能是假阴性，因此他没有再次感染病毒时，瓦隆说有可能。斯塔德勒的妻子也出现了症状，她被诊断为双肺炎。斯塔德勒说，他的儿子仍然认为冠状病毒是一个“骗局”，他希望他的儿子能戴上面具，保持社交距离。“这是我一生中经历过的最糟糕的三四个月，”斯塔德勒说，他因工作短期残疾，他很庆幸自己和妻子攒了一点钱来渡过难关。斯塔德勒说，他仍然感觉到病毒对认知的影响。斯塔德勒说：“我的视力一直很模糊。我有认知问题。从第一次开始我就很难集中注意力。当我去看我的初级保健医生这里的医生时，他们给我做了一个测试。我的分数是14分，这说明我患有痴呆症。”因为一些工人被迫在家里工作，所以不再需要新衣服和更漂亮的衣服。GlobalData Retail周三在一份报告中说，4月至6月，男式正装销售额同比下降了74%。“虽然这种恶化会随着时间的推移而缓解，但随着办公、商务会议和社交活动的减少，需求将在2020年下半年和2021年一直受到抑制。”，GlobalData零售总监。”在昨天的新闻发布会上，佛罗里达州州长罗恩·德桑蒂斯（Ron DeSantis）表示，迈阿密戴德县“应该能够做”联系追踪。迈阿密戴德县市长卡洛斯·吉姆内斯今早对CNN记者约翰·伯曼说：“追踪联系人实际上是州政府的职权范围。”。吉米内斯说：“我们愿意尽我们所能提供帮助。”“我们正在接近，但是……为了争取到更多的人，这比我希望的要长一点。”。吉姆内斯补充说，合同追踪虽然有用，但可能对这种新型冠状病毒没有那么大帮助，因为有那么多无症状的病例。吉姆内斯补充说，如果冠状病毒病例继续激增，他将不愿意在8月底开学，尽管州政府下令开放，迈阿密戴德县已成为佛罗里达州Covid-19危机的中心。迈阿密戴德县政府公布的数据显示，该县14天的平均阳性率为23%。7月7日阳性率为27%。观察：尽管佛罗里达州教育专员理查德·科科兰（Richard Corcoran）颁布命令，要求所有学校在秋季以“实体店”的方式重新开学，迈阿密戴德县的学校只有在该县进入重新开学计划的第二阶段时才会重新开课，这是迈阿密戴德县公立学校负责人阿尔贝托·卡瓦略（Alberto Carvalho）在推特上宣布的。卡瓦略说，该县目前仍处于第一阶段，“学生和员工的福祉仍然是我们的首要任务，”卡瓦略说。该县已成为佛罗里达州Covid-19危机的中心。根据迈阿密戴德县政府公布的最新数据，在过去的13天里，该县的Covid-19患者住院人数（87%）、ICU床位数（91%）和呼吸机（108%）的使用量都有惊人的增长。根据县政府公布的数据，全县14天平均阳性率为23%。7月7日阳性率为27%。##佛罗里达州Covid-19仪表盘的数据官员丽贝卡·琼斯（Rebekah Jones）说，她被从该州的项目中删除后，她启动了自己的仪表盘，她说，她看不到该州冠状病毒激增的结束。琼斯对CNN记者约翰·伯曼说：“尤其是如果下个月学校要开学，那么我们就进入了第一波灾难的第三波。佛罗里达州不追踪可能的冠状病毒病例，琼斯解释说。当人们到达急诊室接受检查时，“在佛罗里达州卫生部收到他们的阳性检测结果之前，这不算是一个积极的住院治疗。”“如果他们开始报告可能的病例，我们可能会看到不仅病例，而且死亡人数会大幅上升，她说。一些背景：在佛罗里达州卫生部说她在那里的任期内“表现出一种反复的不服从命令的行为”，琼斯被从仪表盘上除名。她说：“我被反复告知，我们没有增加住院数据，尽管我们所有的流行病学家都说，这是我们医疗系统如何处理大量病例的最重要指标之一。”她说，她在卫生部有联系人，他们偶尔会给她提供文件，而且许多县的处理能力为70-80%。“现有的数据是有的，只是他们自己没有公布，”琼斯说。琼斯补充说，她的数据显示，冠状病毒病例增长率最高的是18岁以下，与前几周相比，上周增幅最低的是18至35岁年龄组。观察：热点地区英国财政大臣宣布了一项重大支出计划，以在英国创造就业机会，因为英国政府希望推动其从冠状病毒大流行中恢复过来。瑞希-桑纳克宣布了一项计划，旨在促进青年就业，创造绿色就业机会，并鼓励雇主通过新的保留工作计划，让政府为截至2021年1月31日仍在工作的每名休假雇员支付1000英镑的奖金为酒店业减税40亿英镑。四月份，80%的酒店公司停止交易，140万酒店从业人员根据英国财政部的数据，在所有行业中，休假比例最高。政府计划的成本包括高达90亿英镑用于重新雇用休假工人，20亿英镑计划雇用年轻工人，以及价值20亿英镑的用于改善绿色家园以创造绿色就业机会的补助金。“我们的计划有一个明确的目标：保护、支持和创造就业机会，”Sunak在周三的夏季声明中说。“这将使企业有信心留住和聘用员工。哈佛大学和麻省理工学院周三起诉特朗普政府，要求其在今年秋季学期不允许外国学生只参加网上课程。哈佛大学本周早些时候宣布，所有课程教学都将通过网络授课，包括住在校园的学生。在向CNN提供的一份声明中，该校表示，该指导将影响大约5000名国际学生。“命令不声不响地下达了，它的残酷程度超过了它的鲁莽。哈佛大学校长拉里·巴科在一份声明中说：“这似乎是为了给大学施加压力，让他们在今年秋天开放校内课堂进行面对面的教学，而不考虑学生、教师和其他人的健康和安全。”。“这是在美国创下每日新增感染人数纪录之际，超过300人，麻省理工学院院长拉斐尔·雷夫在一份声明中说，这项措施“扰乱了我们的留学生的生活，危及了他们的学术和研究事业。”“我们的留学生现在有很多问题——关于他们的签证、健康、家庭以及他们继续工作的能力获得麻省理工学院学位。不言而喻，但毫无疑

英文.title: US admirals in South China Sea: Everyone wears a mask
英文.content: Two US Navy admirals in charge of a rare South China Sea exercise say "extraordinary" coronavirus measures taken by the service, including requiring all sailors to wear face masks, have left their aircraft carrier strike groups in a high state of readiness in one of the most tense maritime environments in the world. The Navy's response to the pandemic comes after one of its Pacific-based carriers, the USS Theodore Roosevelt, was crippled for weeks earlier this year by an outbreak that infected hundreds of its crew. "We've taken extraordinary measures to protect our sailors from Covid, but that said it remains a real threat and requires constant vigilance," Rear Adm. George Wikoff, commander of Carrier Strike Group 5, led by the USS Ronald Reagan, said Wednesday in a phone call about the South China Sea deployment. "The entire team underway, everyone on board, is required to wear a mask," Wikoff said. The Navy has also spaced out mealtimes, instituted social distancing and brought aboard specialists including microbiologists and extra health personnel, said Wikoff and Adm. James Kirk, commander of Carrier Strike Group 11, led by the USS Nimitz. "Those measures have all been effective, and we are sailing Covid-free right now," Wikoff said. Wikoff and Kirk spoke to CNN after leading their groups, totaling more than 12,000 sailors and aviators, in a dual-carrier deployment to South China Sea, the first time two of the US Navy's massive warships have exercised in the region in six years. US Navy gets past Covid-19 problem The deployment, which saw the two carriers and their escorts operate 24 hours a day while launching hundreds of aircraft sorties daily, comes as the US itself is struggling with a surge in Covid-19 cases and how to stem infection rates. There is division in the country on wearing masks, enacting social distancing measures and when and to what degree to open everything from stores to schools to sports stadiums. With tens of thousands of new infections being reported in the US daily, the country is nearing 3 million infections in total since the coronavirus outbreak began earlier this year. More than 1,000 of those Covid-19 cases were among the crew of the Theodore Roosevelt, which was left tied up in Guam for weeks in the spring. Smaller outbreaks were reported among crews of both the Reagan and Nimitz, but Kirk said the Navy turned that situation around. "The strike group has remained Covid-free since early April," Kirk said Wednesday. "We've been very effective in applying the mitigation measures that have been put in place to protect the health and readiness of the crew and the strike group," he said. The earlier outbreaks left the US Navy open to criticism by rival China, which touted its readiness while the Pentagon fought the virus on US ships.  Analyst Carl Schuster, a former director of operations at the US Pacific Command's Joint Intelligence Center, said the dual-carrier exercise in the South China Sea was designed to send a message to Beijing. "The US Navy is back following the Covid-19-driven reduced activity," Schuster said. The admirals said Wednesday their deployment to the South China Sea, almost all of which China claims as its territory, was intended to underscore the US Navy's commitment to a free and open Indo-Pacific. "If there are nations that have excessive claims, we will challenge those," Kirk said. China criticizes US exercises Beijing on Monday labeled the US' presence in the region as destabilizing. "The US action is intended to drive a wedge between countries, promote the militarization of the South China Sea, and undermine peace and stability in the South China Sea," Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Zhao Lijian said at a briefing. In a report in China's state-sponsored Global Times, Beijing called the US carriers "nothing more than paper tigers on China's doorsteps" and said Beijing has more than enough firepower to defend its positions in the South China Sea. "The South China Sea is fully within the grasp of the People's Liberation Army (PLA), and any US aircraft carrier movement in the region is closely watched and taken aim at by the PLA, which has a wide range of anti-aircraft carrier weapons like the DF-21D and DF-26, which are both regarded as 'aircraft carrier killer' missiles," the Global Times report said. "Any US #aircraftcarrier movement in the region is at the pleasure of PLA," Global Times tweeted, along with pictures of the Chinese missile. The US Navy quickly responded:  "And yet, there they are. Two @USNavy aircraft carriers operating in the international waters of the South China Sea. #USSNimitz & #USSRonaldReagan are not intimidated #AtOurDiscretion," the US Navy's chief of information tweeted. For all the web-based rhetoric, the two admirals said their operations in the South China Sea were routine. They said that Chinese warships monitored the US exercises, but the operations were professional and safe. "We certainly saw the PLA Navy and they saw us," said Kirk.
英文.title_zh: 美国海军上将在南海：每个人都戴着面具
英文.content_zh: 负责一次罕见的南海演习的两名美国海军上将说，海军采取了“非同寻常”的冠状病毒措施，包括要求所有水兵戴上口罩，使他们的航空母舰攻击群在世界上最紧张的海洋环境之一处于高度戒备状态。今年早些时候，美国海军在太平洋地区的一艘航母西奥多·罗斯福号（USS Theodore Roosevelt）因感染数百名船员的疫情而瘫痪数周后，美国海军才做出了应对。”“我们已经采取了非常措施来保护我们的水兵不受科维德的攻击，但这说明它仍然是一个真正的威胁，需要时刻保持警惕，”海军陆战队罗纳德·里根（USS Ronald Reagan）率领的第5航母攻击群指挥官乔治·维科夫（George Wikoff）海军少将周三在一次有关南中国海部署的电话中说整个正在进行的团队，船上的每个人，都必须戴上口罩。威科夫和尼米兹号航空母舰第11航母攻击群指挥官柯克上将（Adm.James Kirk）说，海军还安排了用餐时间，建立了社交距离，并引进了包括微生物学家和额外卫生人员在内的专家。”这些措施都是有效的，我们现在正在自由航行。维科夫和柯克在带领他们的团队，总共超过12000名水兵和飞行员，在前往南中国海的双航母部署后接受了CNN的采访，这是美国海军的两艘大型军舰六年来首次在该地区进行演习。美国海军克服了Covid-19的问题，这两艘航母及其护卫队每天24小时运作，同时每天出动数百架次的飞机，与此同时，美国自身也在努力应对Covid-19病例激增以及如何遏制感染率的问题。在戴口罩、制定社会距离措施以及何时、在多大程度上开放从商店到学校到体育场馆的一切，在全国都存在分歧。随着美国日报报道数以万计的新感染病例，自今年早些时候冠状病毒爆发以来，美国的感染总数接近300万。西奥多·罗斯福号（Theodore Roosevelt）的船员中就有1000多个Covid-19型战机，该船今年春天被困在关岛数周。据报道，“里根”号和“尼米兹”号的船员中都有小规模的疫情爆发，但柯克说，海军扭转了这种局面。”柯克星期三说：“自4月初以来，罢工组织一直没有受到科维德的攻击。”我们已经非常有效地应用了已经采取的缓解措施，以保护机组人员和突击队的健康和准备状态。”。早些时候的疫情爆发让美国海军面临竞争对手中国的批评，中国吹嘘自己已经做好准备，而五角大楼则在美国舰艇上抗击病毒。美国太平洋司令部联合情报中心前作战主任、分析师卡尔·舒斯特（Carl Schuster）说，在南中国海举行的双航母演习旨在向北京传递一个信息。”舒斯特说：“在科维德-19减少活动之后，美国海军又回来了。”。海军上将星期三说，他们部署到南中国海，几乎所有的南海都声称是中国的领土，这是为了强调美国海军对自由和开放的印度-太平洋的承诺。”柯克说：“如果有国家有过多的要求，我们将挑战这些国家。中国批评美国周一在北京举行的演习，称美国在该地区的存在破坏稳定。”中国外交部发言人赵立坚在一次吹风会上说：“美国的行动意在挑拨国家间的隔阂，推动南海军事化，破坏南海的和平与稳定。”。在中国官方主办的《环球时报》的一篇报道中，北京称美国航母“只不过是中国门口的纸老虎”，并说北京有足够的火力保卫自己在南中国海的阵地。”南海完全掌握在中国人民解放军的掌控范围内，美国在该地区的任何航母运动都受到中国人民解放军的密切关注和瞄准，中国人民解放军拥有广泛的反航母武器，如东风-21D和东风-26，都被视为“航母杀手”导弹，“环球时报的报道说。”“任何美国航空母舰在该地区的移动都是中国人民解放军的荣幸，”环球时报在推特上发布了中国导弹的照片。美国海军迅速作出回应：“然而，他们在那里。两艘@USNavy航空母舰在南中国海国际水域作业。#美国海军信息主管在推特上写道：“美国海军情报部长乌斯尼米兹和美国罗纳德里根并没有被吓倒。对于所有基于网络的言论，两位海军上将表示，他们在南中国海的行动是例行公事。他们说中国军舰监视美国演习，但行动是专业和安全的。”我们当然看到了解放军海军，他们也看到了我们，”柯克说。

英文.title: Coronavirus pandemic: Updates from around the world
英文.content:
Coronavirus can lead to neurological complications, including delirium, brain inflammation, stroke and nerve damage, a new University College London (UCL) study published Tuesday in the journal Brain finds. While respiratory symptoms are commonly associated with coronavirus, for some patients in the study, neurological complications were the first and most significant indication that they had contracted the virus. Of 43 confirmed or suspected Covid-19 patients at the University College London Hospital, researchers identified 10 with delirium, 12 with brain inflammation, eight with cases of stroke and eight with nerve damage. They include a woman who seemed to recover and was sent home. “She was disoriented and displayed ritualistic behavior such as putting her coat on and off repeatedly. She reported visual hallucinations, seeing lions and monkeys in her house,” the researchers wrote. One patient died of brain-destroying encephalitis. The researchers called for close surveillance of the rare and sometimes fatal inflammatory disorder called acute disseminated encephalomyelitis (ADEM). They identified nine cases of ADEM, which is prevalent in children, over a five-week period. “In Greater London… we would expect to see this incidence of cases in five months, which indicates that COVID-19 is associated with an increased incidence of ADEM,” the study states. The study’s findings suggest that neurological complications were likely a result of immune response to the virus, rather than a result of the virus directly attacking the brain. Researchers say these neurological complications are similar to those related to other coronavirus outbreaks: SARS in 2003 and MERS in 2012. “Given that the disease has only been around for a matter of months, we might not yet know what long-term damage Covid-19 can cause,” said UCL researcher Ross Paterson. “Doctors need to be aware of possible neurological effects, as early diagnosis can improve patient outcomes.”  He added that people recovering from the virus should seek professional health advice if they experience neurological symptoms. The researchers said their study was biased toward severe disease. They called for additional research to assess the neurological and neuropsychological consequences of Covid-19. Outside experts agree that more research is needed on the topic. “We’ve already seen that some people with COVID-19 may need a long rehabilitation period – both physical rehabilitation such as exercise, and brain rehabilitation,” said David Strain, a senior clinical lecturer at the University of Exeter Medical School. “We need to understand more about the impact of this infection on the brain.”  Watch: ##Cases## Colombia's President Ivan Duque extended lockdown measures until at least August 1, as the country reported a record number of new coronavirus cases on Tuesday. The announcement on Colombian television came as the country registered 149 new coronavirus deaths and 4,213 new coronavirus cases in the past 24 hours. This is the highest daily count of new cases since the beginning of the pandemic, according to data collected by the Colombian Ministry of Health. Duque also announced that mayors in cities less impacted by the pandemic will have the authority to allow partial reopenings of restaurants, museums and churches starting July 15. The government will also evaluate allowing domestic flights in selected cities, Duque said. Colombia has recorded a total of 124,494 coronavirus cases, according to the Ministry of Health. The majority of cases are reported in the capital city of Bogota and the northern Atlantic coast. ##Hotspots## ##Cases## Washington Gov. Jay Inslee said the reason Covid-19 test results have been delayed is because of Southern states reopening early.  Inslee said there were a couple of reasons for the delay including an “analytical choke point from the labs." "The labs have been slower. Why? It's because governors in southern states listened to Donald Trump and they reopened their businesses way too fast and they let thousands of people rush into bars, and as a result, they've got massive surges of pandemics in Texas and Florida and other states, and as a result they put pressure on the analytical labs to get all these testing done. So we wish that was not the case. We wish them well in these Southern states," he said. Inslee said the federal government never provided an adequate number of necessary test kits to solve the testing problem and when they finally got the test kits, they were mismatched or not packaged properly. ##Cases## ##Hotspots## South Dakota Gov. Kristi Noem tweeted Tuesday that she tested negative for Covid-19. Noem said she had also tested negative on Friday before meeting with President Trump. The President traveled to Mount Rushmore National Memorial in Keystone, South Dakota, on Friday for an early Fourth of July fireworks celebration. Noem worked with the President and the Department of Interior to make the event happen. “I've always taken #COVID19 very seriously, but South Dakota trusted our citizens to exercise their personal responsibility to keep themselves and their loved-ones safe,” Noem tweeted.  In an appearance on Fox News Tuesday, Noem was asked about also coming into contact with Kimberly Guilfoyle, the girlfriend of Donald Trump Jr. who has tested positive for Covid-19, over the weekend. Noem responded saying “we need to remember that Kimberly was asymptomatic and the science of the virus tells us that it’s very, very difficult to spread the virus when you’re asymptomatic.” “I was tested again today, which came back negative again. So I appreciated the opportunity to spend time talking about the issues that were important to South Dakota in my time with Secretary Bernhardt, and with the President and look forward to bringing more solutions to my state,” the governor added. Republican Party of Texas State Chairman James Dickey said the party has no plans to cancel the GOP in-person convention scheduled July 16 in Houston.  He made the announcement in a live video. The state Republican Executive committee voted to proceed with an in-person convention, according to Dickey. The convention attendees will be required to wear masks when it is not feasible to maintain six feet of social distancing.  Dickey said they have "a path forward" to holding an online convention if the need arises in an emergency. "It has always been a backup plan," Dickey said.  Dickey said Houston Mayor Sylvester Turner pressured them to cancel the in-person GOP convention that is set to take place on July 16 at the George R. Brown Convention Center. "Yesterday, Houston Mayor Sylvester Turner held a press conference pressuring us to cancel our convention, trying to shame us and our sponsors. He listed a litany of demands," Dickey said. "We have already put in place most of those things because we've been working hard in glove with his staff at the Convention Center on these exact precautions for weeks." Thermal checks at entrances, limited entryways, masks, and spaced out seating are some of the safety measures that would be implemented, according to Dickey.  "We had already incurred significant additional costs to ensure that each room would be at no more than 50% capacity. And based on current reservations, we expected to average closer to 30% capacity, allowing for safe social distancing even in the caucus sessions," Dickey said. "Each meeting area will be deep cleaned after each gathering to prepare for the next meeting." On Monday, Turner, speaking at a news conference, said he was sending a letter to the executive director of the Republican Party of Texas to "strongly encourage" the GOP to cancel its in-person convention. Turner said hosting the convention in Houston at this time was a "bad idea."  Hear more: ##Hotspots## Columbia University will welcome back 60% of undergraduates in Columbia College and the Fu Foundation School of Engineering and Applied Science, University President Lee Bollinger announced in an email. Most classes will still be taught remotely or in a hybrid form, and faculty are being given a choice whether they want to teach in person, online or a combination of the two. The school will adopt a three term calendar, with a fall term beginning on September 8, as scheduled and going all remote after Thanksgiving, a spring term beginning in early January and a summer term from May 3 to June 18. Similar to several other Ivy League schools, different classes will be on campus at different times, with first and second years invited for the fall term, third and fourth years invited for the spring term. Additional safety measures include requiring face masks at all times unless in a private room with a door closed and requiring a test for every individual returning to campus, along with a daily symptom self-check. ##Schools## Brazil recorded 45,305 new Covid-19 cases Tuesday after its own president also tested positive for the virus, according to Brazil's health ministry. The country now has a total of 1,668,589 coronavirus cases. The ministry also recorded 1,254 new deaths from the virus, more than doubling the previous daily increase. Brazil's death toll stands at 66,741.  Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro himself announced his diagnosis, speaking on Brazilian TV channels Tuesday. "Everyone knew that it would reach a considerable part of the population sooner or later. It was positive for me," he said, referring to the Covid-19 test he took Monday. Bolsonaro downplayed the virus as a "little flu" for months. He has often appeared in public and at rallies without a face mask, even hugging supporters. Brazil is second only to the United States in numbers of coronavirus infections and deaths.  Watch: ##Cases## ##Hotspots## The Shelby County Health Department in Tennessee ordered bars to close again, citing an uptick in Covid-19 cases. The county includes Memphis, one of the state's largest cities.  The order goes into effect Wednesday night at midnight.  "Our numbers have trended upward since Memorial Day, and that has continued," said Alisa Haushalter, Shelby County's Health Department director, at a news conference Tuesday announcing the new directive.  Restaurants for now can remain open until 10 p.m., but she said the department is looking to reduce capacity there, as well as at gyms.  Shelby County saw more than 12,000 new Covid 19 cases on Monday, 146 more than the day before, according to Haushalter.  "As of this morning, we have our highest number of people hospitalized with Covid," she said, warning the county is "moving toward a surge." A team including members from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and Federal Emergency Management Agency spent three days in the area last week, one of 10 regions selected by federal officials for intervention toward slowing Covid-19 growth. Haushalter said the team sent a report to her Tuesday morning, and the new restrictions are based in part on the recommendations from that report. ##Cases## ##Hotspots## The Texas Education Agency said in a statement parents have the option to choose remote learning for their children. "The Texas Education Agency today announced comprehensive guidelines for students to return to school, prioritizing their health and safety while ensuring that students receive quality instruction, whether they choose to learn in a safe on-campus environment or remotely," the statement said. "The guidance laid out today will provide flexibility to both parents and districts to make decisions based on the ever-changing conditions of this public health crisis."  On-campus learning will be available to all parents who would like their students to learn in school, according to the statement.  The agency will also have the option to choose remote learning," initially, or at any point as the year progresses." Masks will be required while in school buildings and there will be some mandated health procedures for every school in the state, according to the statement. ##Schools## ##Hotspots## A top diplomat from Germany expressed support for the World Health Organization Tuesday, calling for global solidarity as the US announced plans to withdraw from the organization. “This virus doesn't stop at any borders. It doesn't stop at any sort of form of government. It doesn't care about ideologies,” Ricklef Beutin, Germany’s Deputy Chief of Mission, said at an Atlantic Council roundtable on Covid-19. “We can only tackle it and overcome it together. This means solidarity between countries and solidarity, frankly, in our societies.”  Beutin added that Germany supports WHO. “While criticism is welcome – It's not only allowed, it is welcome. It may be justified – we feel that it is not a good idea to hamper the organization, while in the full thrust and brunt of this pandemic,” Beutin said. The coronavirus positivity rate in Los Angeles has jumped more than 2% to 11.6%, according to the L.A. County Department of Public Health.  On Monday, the county reported the rate, which is a seven-day rolling average, as 9.5%. More than 1.2 million tests have been conducted in the county to date. Los Angeles reported 4,015 confirmed cases, about 2,000 of which are attributed to three-day backlog from one lab. This brings the county’s total number of confirmed cases to at least 120,539. Nearly 2,000 people are hospitalized in Los Angeles County, with 27% of those in intensive care units, according to a statement from the department. More than 3,500 people have died from Covid-19 in the county, and about 93% of those have had underlying health conditions. ##Hotspots## ##Cases## Long Island has been cleared by global public health experts to enter phase four reopening, New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo announced Tuesday. As long as guidelines are followed, higher education institutions can reopen for in-person activities, as well as low-risk indoor and outdoor arts and entertainment businesses. Professional sports competitions with no fans can also take place. Cuomo cited the resurgence of Covid-19 cases across the country, noting New York has maintained low hospitalizations and low numbers of positive case because people are being vigilant. “However, this pandemic is far from over, and I encourage New Yorkers to continue practicing the basic behaviors—wearing masks, washing hands and social distancing—that have made an enormous difference in the state's ability to fight the virus,” Cuomo said in a statement. “Local governments likewise have vital roles to play in enforcing state guidelines so we can keep COVID-19 at bay and continue pursuing the state's incremental, data-driven reopening," the statement added. ##Reopening## The New York City Board of Health voted unanimously Tuesday to rescind its April orders closing regulated child care facilities, paving the way for facilities to reopen on July 13. The Department of Health ordered all child care providers to close on April 6 except those necessary to allow essential work to continue. In considering the move to reopen child care, Commissioner of Health Dr. Oxiris Barbot noted that though there had been isolated cases of Covid-19 among staff providing health care to the children of essential workers, there have to date been no outbreaks related to ongoing child care. Staff at the facilities will be required to wear masks, and any children over the age of five will be encouraged to do so. Children must be cared for in groups of 15 or less, and children and staff cannot rotate between groups. Earlier Tuesday, Mayor Bill de Blasio said it was “crucial” to reopen child care facilities. ##Reopening## President Trump said Republicans are “very flexible” with how they’ll hold their upcoming convention, which is currently scheduled to take place in Jacksonville, Florida, in August.  Trump was asked by Gray Television’s Greta Van Susteren if he would consider not having as large of a convention as coronavirus case numbers surge in Florida.  “Well, we're always looking at different things. When we signed in Jacksonville, we wanted to be in North Carolina,” Trump said, according to a transcript of the interview released Tuesday. “That almost worked out, but the governor didn't want to have people use the arena, essentially. And so I said, ‘Too bad for North Carolina.’” “And then we went to Florida,” he continued, “And when we went, when we signed a few weeks ago, it looked good. And now all of a sudden it's spiking up a little bit and that's going to go down.”  “It really depends on the timing,” Trump said. “Look, we're very flexible. We can do a lot of things, but we're very flexible.” President Trump said he thinks the country is “in a good place” with the pandemic, adding he disagrees with Dr. Anthony Fauci’s assessment that the country is still “knee-deep” in a first wave of Covid-19. “Well, I think we are in a good place. I disagree with him,” Trump told Gray Television’s Greta Van Susteren, according to a transcript of the interview released Tuesday. “Dr. Fauci said don't wear masks and now he says wear them. And he said numerous things. Don't close off China. Don't ban China. I did it anyway. I didn't listen to my experts and I banned China. We would have been in much worse shape.” “We've done a good job,” Trump said. “I think we are going to be in two, three, four weeks, by the time we next speak, I think we're going to be in very good shape.” The President went on to say there were virus spikes in “some areas that looked like we were going to escape, that they were going to escape, and all of a sudden it became hot.” “But I think you're going to see with all of the things that we're doing, and with all of the therapeutics that are coming out, and then ultimately the vaccine, we're going to be in very good shape very soon,” he said. Some background: Fauci, the nation's top infectious disease expert, said Monday the status of the coronavirus pandemic in the US is "really not good" as new cases surge across the country.  "We are still knee-deep in the first wave of this. And I would say, this would not be considered a wave. It was a surge, or a resurgence of infections superimposed upon a baseline," Fauci said in Facebook Live interview with National Institutes of Health Director Dr. Francis Collins.  Hear more: Five community-based testing sites in Sacramento, California, are closing due to supply shortages, county spokesperson Janna Haynes told CNN Tuesday. It comes as more states are facing new constraints with scaling their testing capabilities. The sites, operated by UC Davis, are experiencing a "supply chain issue for elements of the test kits," she said.  The following five testing sites, located primarily in Sacramento's lower-income areas, are suspending operations until further notice: Natomas Unified School District​ building
S​outh Sacramento Christian Center 
Tetteh Pediatric Health​ Center
La Familia’s Maple Neighborhood Center
Robertson Community Center Following these closures, Sacramento Health will have one community testing site at St. Paul's Missionary Baptist Church and one drive-thru testing site. The county also has a partnership with the National Guard that resumed pop-up testing this week to support testing efforts, Haynes said.  The latest numbers: To date, Sacramento has completed a total of 125,350 tests and 3.6% of these tests delivered positive results. Last week, however, 6.7% of tests in Sacramento were positive, county data shows. Sacramento also remains one of the 23 counties on Gov. Gavin Newsom's "monitoring list" with 4,566 total cases and 76 deaths. ##Cases## The total number of Covid-19 cases in Georgia has reached 100,470, the state’s Department of Public Health said Tuesday. The state also reported at least 2,899 people have died from the virus, the agency said. Georgia has become the ninth state in the country to record more than 100,000 coronavirus cases. ##Cases## ##Hotspots## New Hampshire Gov. Chris Sununu said he would not call for a mask order surrounding President Trump’s rally in the state on Saturday. “We've treated all gatherings in the state, from the time the pandemic began to today, the same, whether they were the Black Lives Matter protests, whether there were protests on the Statehouse lawn, whether it's a political rally, whatever it is, everyone's always treated the same,” Sununu told reporters at a news conference Tuesday, “so to have a mask order for one and not the other isn't fair, doesn't make sense.” In an email announcing Saturday’s rally, the Trump campaign wrote, “There will be ample access to hand sanitizer and all attendees will be provided a face mask that they are strongly encouraged to wear,” but has not indicated they will mandate wearing masks. “We've heard from the Trump campaign that they'll be wearing masks themselves,” Sununu said. “Which we're very happy to see." "You know, I expect I'll be there to greet the President when he arrives, as I always have, and I'll be wearing my mask," he added.  Asked if he’d attend the rally, Sununu dodged, saying, “My plan right now is to be there to greet the President. I don't know if I'll be in the large gathering of the rally, I tend to avoid those types of situations as much as I can.” ##Masks## ##Politics## Shortly after Ohio Gov. Mike DeWine said seven Ohio counties, including Butler County, will be under a mandatory mask order for public spaces starting Wednesday evening, Butler County Sheriff Richard K. Jones said he would not be enforcing the order. “I want to make sure everybody understands, I am not the mask police. I am not going to enforce any mask wearing, that is not my responsibility,” Jones said. “It's not my job. People should be able to make that choices themselves. I didn't put this order out and it's getting to the point people are scared, people are calling and asking, do we have to wear the mask in our house, in our cars. It's getting kind of ridiculous at this point.” “It should be left up to the individual if they want to wear a mask if someone's sick. I can understand the mask wearing, but for all of us to have to have your temperature taken, to have to wear a mask, where's it going to stop?” he said. Jones added: “I'm not a scientist, but I want you to know that the police are busy, our budgets have been cut, the fire department’s, everybody has less, just in the past few months. This does not make it better. What you have is, don't call 911 because someone is not wearing a mask. If the Health Department's want to control and take care of who's not wearing a mask, let them put a little yellow light on their car, and they can stop people, and go in, they will not like the response. People are tired, they're wore out." Jones said the issue could have been handled in a different way, adding neither he nor any of his deputies would be enforcing mask wearing by the public. “We've got more important things to do," he said. "It's all we can do to keep up with fighting crime, locking people up and making sure they're safe and the employees are safe.” ##Masks## Dr. Deborah Birx, White House coronavirus response coordinator, suggested Tuesday the US would work to make sure the world has access to a coronavirus vaccine. Asked about “vaccine nationalism” – that is, once a vaccine is discovered, nations might try to restrict distribution beyond their borders – Birx said the US would continue to support global health efforts, as it has always done. “We have been collaborating between Europe and the United States on development of vaccines. Obviously we're working collaboratively with our British colleagues, with their vaccine with Oxford and AstraZeneca. I think we were working together, across multiple platforms of vaccines to make sure that vaccines are available,” Birx said at an online event put on by the Atlantic Council to discuss the shaping the post-Covid world.    “We are the largest investor in HIV, TB and malaria around the world, not only investing dollars but investing Americans around the world through our embassies, combating these diseases on the ground, working with our counterparts in nations around the world,” she said. Birx continued: “And so, I would imagine like always, in all the work that we do both domestically and globally, we will be there on the global health front, supporting the world, in their response." Mississippi Lt. Gov. Delbert Hosemann has tested positive for Covid-19, his staff said, CNN affiliate WAPT reported Tuesday. Staff members in Hosemann’s office said Hosemann told state Senate members he is positive for the virus, according to WAPT. On Sunday, Mississippi’s House Speaker Philip Gunn said via Facebook that he also tested positive for Covid-19 after coming in contact a few days ago with a House member who had tested positive for the virus. Meanwhile, Gov. Tate Reeves announced earlier on Tuesday that he and his daughters tested negative for the virus, tweeting they had “limited contact with the people who were diagnosed.”  The governor’s press office declined to comment when asked if Hosemann tested positive and CNN also reached out to his office but has not heard back. ##Cases## Texas reported 10,028 new Covid-19 cases on Tuesday, the highest single-day increase in coronavirus cases in the state. On June 1, Mexico entered the new Covid-19 phase, reopening certain sectors of the economy under what they deemed the “new normal.” Meanwhile, the country reported 93,435 cases and 10,167 deaths that day.  On July 6, Mexico reported 261,750 cases of coronavirus and 31,119 virus-related deaths, according to official data.  ##Cases## ##Hotspots##  Iraq on Tuesday recorded 2,426 new coronavirus cases, according to the country's health ministry. 英文.title_zh: 冠状病毒大流行：来自世界各地的最新情况
英文.content_zh: 伦敦大学学院（UCL）周二发表在《大脑发现》杂志上的一项新研究表明，冠状病毒会导致神经系统并发症，包括谵妄、脑炎症、中风和神经损伤。虽然呼吸系统症状通常与冠状病毒有关，但对于研究中的一些患者来说，神经系统并发症是他们感染病毒的第一个也是最重要的迹象。在伦敦大学学院医院的43名确诊或疑似Covid-19患者中，研究人员确认10名患者患有谵妄，12名患有脑部炎症，8名患有中风，8名患有神经损伤。其中包括一名似乎已经康复并被送回家的妇女。她迷失了方向，表现出仪式性的行为，比如反复穿脱外套。研究人员写道：“她报告说，在她家里看到狮子和猴子，会产生幻觉。”。1例死于脑破坏性脑炎。研究人员呼吁密切监视罕见的有时致命的炎症性疾病，称为急性播散性脑脊髓炎（ADEM）。他们在五个星期内发现了9例流行于儿童的ADEM病例。“在大伦敦……我们预计在5个月内会出现这种病例，这表明COVID-19与ADEM的发病率增加有关，”研究指出。研究结果表明，神经系统并发症很可能是病毒免疫反应的结果，而不是病毒直接攻击大脑的结果。研究人员说，这些神经并发症与其他冠状病毒爆发相关的并发症相似：2003年的SARS和2012年的MERS。加州大学洛杉矶分校的研究人员RossPaterson说：“考虑到这种疾病仅仅出现了几个月，我们可能还不知道Covid-19会造成什么样的长期损害。”。“医生需要意识到可能的神经系统影响，因为早期诊断可以改善患者的预后。”他补充说，从病毒中恢复的人如果出现神经症状，应该寻求专业的健康建议。研究人员说他们的研究偏向于严重疾病，他们呼吁进行更多的研究来评估Covid-19对神经和神经心理学的影响。外部专家一致认为，这一课题需要更多的研究。“我们已经看到，一些患有COVID-19的患者可能需要很长的康复期——既包括锻炼等身体康复，也包括大脑康复，”大卫·特赖斯说，埃克塞特大学医学院的高级临床讲师。“我们需要更多地了解这种感染对大脑的影响。”观察：哥伦比亚总统伊万·杜克（Ivan Duque）将封锁措施延长至至少8月1日，因为该国周二报告了创纪录的新冠状病毒病例。哥伦比亚电视台宣布这一消息之际，该国在过去24小时内登记了149例新的冠状病毒死亡病例和4213例新的冠状病毒病例。根据哥伦比亚卫生部收集的数据，这是自大流行开始以来每日新增病例数最高的一次。杜克还宣布，受流感影响较小的城市的市长将有权从7月15日起允许部分餐馆、博物馆和教堂重新开放。杜克说，政府还将评估在选定城市允许国内航班。据卫生部统计，哥伦比亚共记录了124494例冠状病毒病例。大多数病例报告在首都波哥大和北大西洋沿岸。##热点事件华盛顿州州长杰伊·因斯利说，Covid-19测试结果推迟的原因是因为南部各州提前重新开放。Inslee说，延迟的原因有很多，包括“实验室的分析瓶颈”，“实验室进展缓慢”。为什么？这是因为南部各州的州长们听从了唐纳德·特朗普的建议，他们重新开业的速度太快了，他们让成千上万的人冲进酒吧，结果，他们在德克萨斯州、佛罗里达州和其他州爆发了大规模的流行病，结果他们给分析实验室施加了压力，要求他们完成所有这些测试。所以我们希望不是这样。我们祝愿他们在南部各州一切顺利。”。Inslee说，联邦政府从来没有提供足够数量的必要的测试包来解决测试问题，当他们最终得到测试包时，他们是错配或没有正确包装。##南达科他州州长克里斯蒂·诺姆周二在推特上说，她对Covid-19的检测结果呈阴性。诺姆说，她周五在与特朗普总统会晤前也检测出阴性。星期五，奥巴马总统前往位于南达科他州基斯顿的拉什莫尔山国家纪念馆，参加7月4日清晨的焰火晚会勒布拉茨。诺姆与总统和内政部合作，促成了这一事件的发生。诺姆在推特上说：“我一直非常认真地对待科维德，但南达科他州相信我们的公民会履行个人责任，保护自己和亲人的安全。”周二，诺姆在福克斯新闻台（Fox News）上露面时，被问到是否也会与小唐纳德·特朗普（Donald Trump Jr.）的女友金伯利·吉尔福伊尔（Kimberly Guilfoyle）取得联系，她曾接受过测试Covid-19阳性，周末。诺姆回应说：“我们需要记住，金伯利是没有症状的，病毒科学告诉我们，当你没有症状的时候，病毒很难传播。”“我今天再次接受了测试，结果还是阴性。因此，我很感激有机会在我与伯恩哈特部长和总统共事期间，花时间讨论对南达科他州很重要的问题，并期待着为我的州提出更多的解决办法，”州长补充道。德克萨斯州共和党主席詹姆斯迪基说，该党没有计划取消定于7月16日在休斯敦举行的共和党个人代表大会。他在一段视频直播中宣布了这一消息。迪基称，州共和党执行委员会投票通过了一次面对面的会议。在无法保持6英尺的社交距离时，与会者将被要求戴上口罩。迪基说，如果有紧急情况需要，他们“有办法”举行在线会议“这一直是一个后备计划，”迪基说，休斯顿市长西尔维斯特·特纳向他们施压，要求他们取消定于7月16日在乔治·R·布朗会议中心举行的共和党大会昨天，休斯敦市长西尔维斯特·特纳召开记者招待会，向我们施压，要求取消我们的大会，试图让我们和我们的赞助商蒙羞。他列出了一连串的要求我们已经落实了大部分的措施，因为我们已经和他在会议中心的工作人员密切合作，研究这些具体的预防措施。“入口处的热检查、有限的入口通道、面罩和隔开的座位是将要实施的一些安全措施，迪基说：“为了确保每间客房的容量不超过50%，我们已经付出了巨大的额外成本。迪基说：“根据目前的预订情况，我们预计平均载客量将接近30%，这样即使在核心会议上也能保持安全的社交距离。”每一次集会后，每个会议区都将被彻底清理，为下一次会议做准备。”周一，特纳在一次新闻发布会上说，他正在给德克萨斯州共和党（Republic Party of Texas）的执行主任写信，“强烈鼓励”共和党取消其当面大会。特纳说，此时在休斯顿举办大会是一个“坏主意”。听听更多：哥伦比亚大学将欢迎哥伦比亚学院和傅基金会工程与应用科学学院60%的本科生回来，大学校长李博林格在一封电子邮件中宣布。大多数课程仍将以远程或混合形式授课，教师可以选择是亲自授课、在线授课还是两者结合。感恩节和秋季学期从1月18日开学至5月3日，学期安排为春季和秋季，学期开始时间为1月18日和5月8日。与其他几所常春藤盟校类似，不同的班级将在不同的时间进入校园，第一年和第二年是秋季学期，第三年和第四年是春季学期。额外的安全措施包括，除非是在关着门的私人房间内，否则任何时候都需要戴口罩，并且要求每个返回校园的人都要进行测试，并进行每日症状自我检查。##巴西卫生部称，巴西总统也检测出病毒呈阳性，学校周二录得45305例新的Covid-19病例。该国目前共有1668589例冠状病毒病例。卫生部还记录了1254例新的死于该病毒的病例，比以前每天增加一倍多。巴西的死亡人数为66741人。巴西总统博尔索纳罗星期二在巴西电视频道发表讲话，宣布了他的诊断结果每个人都知道它迟早会到达相当一部分人口。这对我来说是阳性的，”他说，指的是他周一进行的Covid-19测试。博尔索纳罗数月来一直淡化这种病毒为“小流感”。他经常不戴面具出现在公众场合和集会上，甚至拥抱支持者。巴西冠状病毒感染和死亡人数仅次于美国。观察：案例、热点、She田纳西州的lby县卫生部门以Covid-19病例上升为由，下令酒吧再次关闭。该县包括孟菲斯，该州最大的城市之一。该法令将于周三午夜生效。“自阵亡将士纪念日以来，我们的人数一直呈上升趋势，而且这种趋势还在继续，”谢尔比县卫生局局长艾莉莎·豪沙尔特（Alisa Haushalter）在周二宣布新指令的新闻发布会上说现在可以一直开放到晚上10点，但她说，卫生部正在考虑减少那里以及健身房的容量。据豪斯哈特说，谢尔比县周一新发现19例Covid病例，比前一天增加146例。她说：“截至今天上午，我们因Covid住院的人数达到了最高水平。”，上周，一个由疾病控制和预防中心和联邦应急管理局成员组成的小组在该地区逗留了三天，这是联邦官员为减缓Covid-19的增长而选择的10个干预地区之一。Haushalter说，研究小组在周二上午向她发送了一份报告，新的限制措施部分是基于该报告中的建议。##德克萨斯州教育局在一份声明中说，家长可以选择为孩子选择远程教育。”德克萨斯州教育局今天宣布了学生重返学校的全面指导方针，优先考虑学生的健康和安全，同时确保学生接受高质量的教学，无论他们选择在安全的校园环境中学习还是远程学习今天制定的指导方针将为家长和学区提供灵活性，使他们能够根据这场公共卫生危机不断变化的情况作出决定。“根据声明，所有希望学生在学校学习的家长都可以在校园内学习。声明称，该机构还可以选择远程学习，“最初，或随着时间的推移随时进行”。在学校大楼里需要戴面具，而且该州每一所学校都会有一些强制性的健康程序。##一位来自德国的高级外交官星期二表示支持世界卫生组织，在美国宣布退出该组织的计划之际，呼吁全球团结一致。“这种病毒不会在任何边界停止。它不会止于任何形式的政府。德国代表团副团长里克勒夫·贝廷在大西洋理事会关于Covid-19的圆桌会议上说。“我们只能共同应对和克服它。这意味着国家之间的团结，坦率地说，在我们的社会中，这意味着团结一致。”贝尤廷补充说，德国支持世卫组织。“尽管批评是受欢迎的，但这不仅是允许的，也是受欢迎的。这也许是有道理的——我们认为，在这场大流行的全面冲击和冲击下，阻碍本组织不是一个好主意。洛杉矶县公共卫生部的数据显示，洛杉矶的冠状病毒阳性率上升了2%以上，达到11.6%。周一，该县公布了7天滚动平均率为9.5%，到目前为止，该县已经进行了120多万次检测。洛杉矶县报告的5000例确诊病例中，至少有1例被确认为53例。洛杉矶县有近2000人住院治疗，其中27%在重症监护室。该县已有3500多人死于Covid-19，其中约93%有潜在的健康问题。##纽约州州长安德鲁·库莫22日宣布，长岛热点病例已被全球公共卫生专家批准进入第四阶段重新开放。只要遵循指导方针，高等院校可以重新开放面对面的活动，以及低风险的室内外艺术和娱乐业务，也可以举行没有球迷的专业体育比赛。库莫列举了全国范围内Covid-19病例的死灰复燃，他指出，纽约一直保持低住院率和低阳性病例数，因为人们都在提高警惕。库莫在一份声明中说：“然而，这场大流行还远未结束，我鼓励纽约人继续练习戴口罩、洗手和保持社交距离的基本行为，这些行为对纽约州抗击病毒的能力产生了巨大的影响。”。“地方政府同样在执行国家指导方针方面扮演着至关重要的角色，这样我们就可以阻止COVID-19，并继续推动该州以数据为驱动的渐进式重新开放。”补充。##纽约市卫生局周二一致表决，撤销4月份关闭受监管儿童保育设施的命令，为7月13日重新开放设施铺平了道路。卫生部命令所有儿童保育机构于4月6日关闭，但为继续开展必要工作所必需的除外。卫生专员Oxiris Barbot博士在考虑重新开放儿童保育的举措时指出，虽然在为基本工作人员的子女提供保健服务的工作人员中出现了Covid-19的孤立病例，但迄今为止没有发生与持续的儿童保育有关的疫情。这些设施的工作人员将被要求戴口罩，并鼓励任何五岁以上的儿童戴口罩。儿童必须在15人或15人以下的小组中得到照顾，儿童和工作人员不能在小组之间轮换。星期二早些时候，市长比尔德布拉西奥说，重新开放儿童保育设施“至关重要”。##特朗普总统说，共和党人对如何举行即将到来的大会“非常灵活”，这次大会目前计划在佛罗里达州杰克逊维尔举行，今年8月，格雷电视台的格雷塔·范·苏斯特伦（Greta Van Susteren）问特朗普，他是否会考虑在佛罗里达州举行一次规模不小的大会，“嗯，我们总是在看不同的事情。当我们在杰克逊维尔签约时，我们希望在北卡罗来纳州，”根据周二公布的采访记录，特朗普说。“这几乎成功了，但州长根本不想让人们使用竞技场。所以我说，“对北卡罗来纳州来说太糟糕了。”“然后我们去了佛罗里达州，”他接着说，“当我们去的时候，当我们几周前签约的时候，看起来不错。特朗普说：“现在突然间，它会上升一点，而这会下降。”“这真的取决于时机，”特朗普说。“听着，我们很灵活。我们可以做很多事情，但我们非常灵活。”特朗普总统说，他认为美国在大流行中“处于一个良好的位置”，并补充说，他不同意安东尼·福奇博士的评估，即该国在第一波Covid-19中仍“齐膝深”。“好吧，我觉得我们的处境很好。我不同意他的说法，”根据周二公布的采访记录，特朗普对格雷电视台的格雷塔·范苏斯特伦说。“福西医生说不要戴口罩，现在他说戴上口罩。他说了很多话。不要关闭中国。不要禁止中国。不管怎样我都做到了。我不听我的专家的话，我禁止了中国。特朗普说：“我们做得很好。”。“我认为我们将在两、三、四个星期后，到我们下一次发言时，我认为我们会处于非常好的状态。”总统接着说，“一些地区的病毒激增，看起来我们要逃跑，他们要逃走，突然间变得很热。”“但我想你会看到我们正在做的所有事情，以及即将推出的所有疗法，以及最终的疫苗，我们很快就会处于非常好的状态。”。一些背景知识：美国顶级传染病专家福奇周一表示，随着美国新病例的激增，美国冠状病毒大流行的状况“真的不好”，“我们还处在第一波疫情中。我要说的是，这不会被认为是波浪。Fauci在接受美国国家卫生研究院院长弗朗西斯·柯林斯（Francis Etienne博士说，这比前一周增加了9%。上周，美洲地区平均每天新增病例超过10万例，接近10万例比前一周上涨20%。艾蒂安在泛美卫生组织每周的疫情简报会上说，目前全美洲已有26.7万人死于冠状病毒，美国几个州以及中美洲和南美洲大部分地区的感染趋势正在加速。她接着说，有一种令人担忧的趋势，即传染病蔓延到迄今为止没有受到太大影响的地区，正如人们对预防措施和行动限制感到疲惫一样。艾蒂安说，流感大流行正从一些大城市向重症监护等设施较少的小城镇蔓延，两个月前，美国约占美洲所有病例的75%。仅在拉丁美洲和加勒比海地区，就有50%的工人对工作条件不安全表示担忧。她重申需要更好地追踪病毒。由于不平等、政治分裂和卫生保健投资不足，病毒的影响更加严重。她预测，接下来的六个月不会比上一个月容易：许多医院正在接近产能，其他疾病和疾病的治疗正在中断。艾蒂安指出，由于获得产前服务变得越来越困难，孕产妇死亡率正在上升。她还对拉丁美洲其他常见的健康问题（从肺结核到糖尿病）的治疗受到保障供应和获得卫生设施方面的问题的影响表示关切。##世界卫生组织的一位官员周二说，世界各地Covid-19病例的数量在继续攀升，而且这种增加“不仅仅是检测的结果”世卫组织卫生应急计划执行主任迈克·瑞安博士在日内瓦的一次简报会上说：“令人担忧的是，疾病数量与日俱增。”四五月份，我们每天要处理10万起案件。今天，我们每天要处理20万个病例，这不仅仅是检测的结果这一流行病正在加速。”Ryan补充说，病例数量的上升是在全球Covid-19死亡率保持稳定的同时发生的，这表明一线医生和护士可能会更早地治疗病人，挽救更多的生命。最新的数字是：现在已经有超过1100万的Covid-19病例据世卫组织统计，全世界有53.5万人死于这一流行病。”世卫组织总干事特德罗斯·阿达诺姆·盖布雷耶苏在周二的简报会上说：“疫情正在加速，我们显然还没有达到大流行的高峰。”泰德罗斯说：“虽然全球死亡人数似乎趋于平稳，但实际上一些国家在减少死亡人数方面取得了重大进展，而在其他国家，死亡人数仍在上升。”在减少死亡方面取得进展的地方，各国都对最弱势群体采取了有针对性的行动，例如那些生活在长期护理设施中的人根据市长官方推特（Twitter）的一条推特，在冠状病毒大流行期间，电影制片厂开业。吉姆内斯在推特上说，里面的人“必须戴上口罩，或者在外面进行艰苦的训练，保持10英尺的距离，不戴口罩”。吉姆内斯还计划发布一项即将出台的行政命令，允许在冠状病毒病例激增的情况下，继续进行户外就餐，但有限制，根据市长办公室发布的一份声明，新的限制要求餐厅的餐桌不超过4人，并允许适当的社交距离。餐厅将被要求播放不需要大声叫喊的音乐，以抑制从人们嘴里释放出潜在危险的空气飞沫。这是对该县重新关闭部分企业决定的部分修改。就在昨天，迈阿密戴德宣布，由于冠状病毒数量激增，包括健身中心在内的某些企业将于周三停业。除了外卖和外卖外，其他餐馆也将关闭。市长预计将在美国东部时间下午12:30与德桑蒂斯州长一起在新闻发布会上发言，两人将在迈阿密市和佛罗里达州发布Covid-19的最新情况。亚利桑那州图森市的热点地区市长雷吉娜·罗梅罗说，她非常担心重症监护病房床位不足和检测工作的无序性随着该州病例激增，合同追踪也在增加。罗梅罗说，重症监护病房的床位容量已达到极限限制。她说，皮马县几天只有5到10张ICU床位可用。“任何一天，我们都要把病人送到其他州，因为我们的能力不足。”罗梅罗说，检测结果花费的时间太长，而且接触者追踪的过程也不连贯。罗梅罗对美国有线电视新闻网（CNN）的凯特·博尔杜安（Kate Bolduan）说：“亚利桑那州发生的事情是……特朗普总统带领我们走向的一个缩影。”。“在这个国家没有协调一致的测试工作，更不用说在亚利桑那州了。”德克萨斯州刑事司法部（TDCJ）称，德克萨斯州监狱系统有9名员工因Covid-19死亡。TDCJ周一宣布，在该机构工作超过30年的惩戒官员V.Kenneth Harbin于7月4日去世，成为第九名因感染病毒而死亡的员工。在TDCJ于7月1日发布的最新信息中，8811名违法者和1556名员工检测出Covid-19呈阳性。其中，84名罪犯死亡，另有28人死亡正在调查中。TDCJ说，他们已经在全系统范围内对117765名罪犯和35662名雇员进行了病毒检测。7月1日，县监狱重新开始对罪犯进行有限的收押。TDJC说，他们正在与各县协调Covid-19筛查程序，以确保每个囚犯都适合接收。一旦犯人到达，他或她将接受医学检查，然后分别隔离14天。根据TDCJ发布的消息，此人随后将被转移到普通人群中的无Covid住房区。每周将有大约250名违法者被带进监狱，TDCJ表示将继续监控数据，以做出扩张的决定。德克萨斯州刑事司法部管理着14.6万名州监狱、监狱和私人惩教设施的罪犯，拥有超过3.6万名员工，春季和夏季-允许所有本科生在三个学期中的两个学期都在校园里，一次减少了在校学生的总数。秋季课程将于9月开始，感恩节后转移到所有偏远地区。春季课程将于1月至4月在校园内进行，然后将移至远程进行期末考试，夏季学期将于5月开始，5月至8月在校园内进行。春季学期和夏季学期将迎来第一年，秋季和春季学期将迎来大三学生和高年级学生，纽约市长比尔德布拉西奥（Bill de Blasio）表示，恢复儿童保育“至关重要”，并宣布纽约市卫生委员会将于今天晚些时候投票决定允许3000个儿童保育中心于7月13日重新开放。他说，这些都将受到国家严格的要求，每间客房的儿童人数不得超过15人，社交距离、工作人员和儿童的面部覆盖物、日常健康检查、经常清洁和消毒、物品共享有限。他说，自4月份以来，只有125个儿童保育项目为基本工人的子女开放。德布拉西奥说，他希望这项措施能够向前推进，并将在周二晚些时候更新其进展情况。##星期二上午，堪萨斯州将宣布对德拉瓦州进行隔离。声明说：“检疫适用于从7天滚动平均值上每10万居民中阳性率高于10%的州或从7天滚动平均值高于10%的州入境的任何人。”。符合检疫标准的19个州是符合检疫标准的三个州。一些背景：周一纽约记录到10例与冠状病毒有关的死亡，使全州死亡人数达到24924人。库莫办公室称，星期一进行的56736次冠状病毒检测中，至少有588次呈阳性（1.04%），巴勒斯坦权力机构（PA）正在努力控制不断增加的新的Covid-19感染人数，西岸南部城市希伯伦是受影响最严重的地区。星期二，巴勒斯坦权力机构报告了306例新的冠状病毒病例，其中278例位于希布伦及其周边地区。西岸的局势与以色列正在发生的情况密切相关。以色列和巴勒斯坦领导人在大流行初期就因对行动实行严格限制而赢得赞扬，导致这两个地区的新感染人数在4月下旬和5月急剧下降。现在，在两位领导人都解除了限制的几周后，冠状病毒的数量又急剧上升。巴勒斯坦权力机构总理穆罕默德·什塔耶赫说，80%以上的新感染者是婚礼或葬礼上聚会的结果。他说，其余的18%是巴勒斯坦工人在以色列感染上这种疾病并将其带回约旦河西岸的结果。在一个有点吸引人的请求中，他呼吁以色列关闭以色列和约旦河西岸之间的过境点，并呼吁巴勒斯坦工人不要在以色列工作，此举将对巴勒斯坦权力机构的国际学生造成不利的经济影响美国移民和海关执法局周一宣布，如果他们的大学改为只开设在线课程，美国的ng学位可能必须离开美国，否则可能面临被驱逐出境的危险。此举可能会影响到成千上万来美国读大学或参加培训项目以及非学术或职业学习的外国学生。由于冠状病毒的流行，全国各地的大学都开始做出向在线课程过渡的决定。例如，在哈佛，所有的课程教学都将在网上进行，包括为住在校园的学生。对于国际学生来说，这为他们不得不离开美国打开了大门。”有太多的不确定性。哈佛大学肯尼迪政府学院的研究生，26岁的瓦莱丽娅·门迪奥拉说如果我必须回墨西哥，我可以回去，但是很多国际学生就是不能。以下是他们的来历：一些背景知识：在周一的新闻发布会上，ICE说，持有某些签证的学生“可能无法完成全部的在线课程，并留在美国，”并补充说，“美国国务院不会向在秋季全面上线的学校和/或项目中注册的学生发放签证美国海关和边境保护局也不允许这些学生进入美国。”该机构建议目前在美国注册的学生考虑采取其他措施，如转学到接受亲自指导的学校。使用混合模式的大学有一个例外，比如混合使用在线和面对面的课程。##澳大利亚当地时间周三午夜（美国东部时间星期二上午10点），澳大利亚关闭了维多利亚州和新南威尔士州之间的州际边界，新南威尔士州是澳大利亚人口最多的两个州，目前正与第二波Covid-19疫情作斗争。这是自1919年西班牙流感大流行以来，两国边界100年来首次关闭。关闭意味着维多利亚州的660万人实际上被切断了与该国其他地区的联系，除非他们有旅行许可证。周二，维多利亚州卫生部门宣布，在过去一天里，全州新增191例Covid-19病例，其中大多数病例集中在州首府墨尔本。观察：在周二的冠状病毒大流行
